Reviews.Title: “History”
Reviews.Author: fotriktig
Reviews.Content: This Joint is no more. It has closed and is sold. It's a shame. I'm happy I managed to spend a night at this "museum". Not for the comfort, but for the atmosphere, history, architechture, art and just for this "been-there" thing. http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2028125/Hotel-Chelsea-New-York-closes-Where-Dylan-Thomas-drank-death.html

Reviews.Title: “Had a two-night booking....left after one....”
Reviews.Author: Richiana
Reviews.Content: This place is terrible....I gave it a two-star rating based on it's history and it is kind of cool to say you visited and stayed at such a legendary place. So yes, that's great...now to the actual HOTEL itself. Don't stay here! For the price, you can do much better in the city of New York. The rooms are dirty, the beds looks so bad that you don't even want to sleep on them (I slept on top of the blankets), all appliances/electrical is outdated, and the WIFI service didn't work most of the time I was there. I told the front desk I had a family emergency and had to leave NYC the next day and they let me get out after one night, which was nice of them. The staff seemed friendly enough, but this place is run-down. Maybe it's me and I don't get the whole "hey, this place is historic and artsy, so it can be a dump" thing but I'll spend my money elsewhere next time. Not for me.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful for what it is”
Reviews.Author: ccmyrd
Reviews.Content: This is not a four-star, fancy hotel where you will be pampered. It is a living piece of history and its charm comes from knowing that the hotel is historic and has seen some amazing things. The rooms are nice and clean. definitely not fancy, but you are also not paying that much (considering its location). If you want a hotel with real charm that is clean and simple, this is your best bet! There are a few great bars nearby and its central location in the city is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Solarium Always Broken”
Reviews.Author: M J
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this hotel. The restaurants, the rooms, the vintage feel of it. However, the last 2 times I've gone there the Sauna and Steam room have been broken. I wish they'd keep the maintenance of it up, definitely one of my favorite things to do at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sold out...but didn't deliver”
Reviews.Author: NoneNamedYet
Reviews.Content: Before the Chelsea sold out to the new proprietor, it was already a dump-- REALLY a dump. There's great history there, sure-- and the paintings in the stairwell were always cool to look at-- but even the "famous"manager of yore was known for ripping off the clientele and for presenting really shoddy rooms. The cockroaches are legendary.The front desk service and office has always been snooty-- still is. The golden days are Waaay gone. But now-- well, there's really no reason to go there. It's still a dump-- but trumped up as something that it's not. It all died here at the end of the 1970s. There's a lot of the city that's still alive-- go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: bomboraboy
Reviews.Content: I would gladly live in the chelsea - a great feeling of artistic camaraderie. sure there are cockroaches and weirdos, but you're in new york. the janis joplin suite is cool - you can see her signature inside the fuse box. great area, great people, the staff take an interest if you do. it's grungey, but I wouldn't stay anywhere else if I could help it. we shot a film there on max's kansas city, and all the people who came to be interviewed in our room really enjoyed having a reason to go back there. fine for kids too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the artsyness!”
Reviews.Author: Digdem
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Chelsea for two nights! I felt lucky not to book my stay longer. You can stay in a more comfy hotel with better room facilities and pay the same price. So, what makes it pricier is only its reputation. Pros: The building is beautiful and a NYC landmark. Nice corridors full of paintings and sculptures by famous artists. The staff I encountered was neat and friendly. The location is good. There are nice cafes, restaurants and bars around. Cons: The rooms are dark and small and the in-room decoration is not as fancy as it is shown on the website. The air-conditioner was noisy. All in all, if you want to enjoy a NYC landmark hotel, stay the night. But one can find better places with the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Serosity
Reviews.Content: First off, if you are looking for a hotel that has standardised rooms, and an up to date feel, the Chelsea is not for you. I stayed here for the atmosphere, and there was lots. My room was clean enough, the bathroom spotless. There was candlewax on the floor by the bed, but hey, this is the Chelsea! I like to think it was from some artist writing by the candlelight the next famous song! The view was pants, but hey, for the price I paid I wasn't expecting much more. I can't vouch for all rooms, since they are all different. I stayed in 402. I loved the feeling in the hotel, the lobby was cool to hang out with. You want to take the stairs so you can see all the artwork on the walls. There was free wifi (that was fast as well). One complaint: I had an early flight and had ordered a cab as well as a wake up call. I got the cab, but not the wake up call (luckily i had set my alarm as well).

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea is dead”
Reviews.Author: hanseknaller
Reviews.Content: In 2008 I stayed in the Chelsea for the first time and had an amazing experience. A doorman trading marijuana in the lift, a large room with a nice old interior, a lot of characters sitting in the lobby, all just very authentic. This time it was all just horrible. Mold in the bathroom, smelly rooms and bad service. And it was full of teenies, not one or two who found the the spot of fame of history, but 80% of the guests have turned the Chelsea into a BnB place. And I also have an explanation why, Wikipedia says: "On June 18, 2007, the hotel's board of directors ousted Bard as the hotel's manager. Dr. Marlene Krauss, the daughter of Julius Krauss, and David Elder, the grandson of Joseph Gross and the son of playwright and screenwriter Lonne Elder III, replaced Stanley Bard with the management company BD Hotels NY" So my advice: don't fall into the tourist trap only because a long time a go, the Chelsea lived up to its reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel...everyone should stay here at least once min their life.”
Reviews.Author: misslindsaykc
Reviews.Content: Good location, cool hotel with lots of history and art work displayed. Not top of the line in regards to hotel cleanliness or decor, not many ammenities. It is a little seedy which is okay for what you get in exchange. Hotel staff was nice. I will say it was the largest room I have ever had when staying in NYC. That was a bonus. Weird noises at night which added to the whole creepy history of this hotel. Not a place for kids to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Try Me One More Time”
Reviews.Author: aussienelson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April and enjoyed it enough to come back for a second time, celebrating my wife's birthday. We had previously gotten a special rate studio with a shared bath, and thought it was fine, in it's Bohemian charming, no-frills kind of way. The hotel itself is really the draw (with it's artwork, facade, lobby and it's colorful stairways) but we were given a surprise to find upon arrival that we were given a free room upgrade, and were now staying in a much larger deluxe studio with a private bath. We never used the kitchen, but loved the fancy chairs and the ambiance. We later found out an infamous robbery happened in the very same room some 35 years ago and made it into Time Magazine. Quotes from Arthur Miller about how much he loves the Chelsea, despite the aftermath of the seedy, high stakes, nude gambling incident that took place in our othe3r-wise very charming room. We found that piece of information very intriguing. Like something out of "Ocean's 11" with Dean Martin. With celebrities, Poets, artists and musicians like Thomas Wolfe, Oscar Wilde, Patti Smith, Robert Mapplethorpe, Bob Dylan, Joan Baez, Sid & Nancy, Leonard Cohen, Jimi Hendrix, Hunter S. Thompson, Allen Ginsberg, Madonna, Sid & Nancy, Ryan Adams, etc. The reason for staying at the Chelsea is to be part of the history, but the hotel is loaded with it's own personality and is a sturdy, clean and comfortable place to stay. It's also very fairly priced, compared to most NYC hotels. You also can't beat the many surrounding Comedy Clubs, Bars, Restaurants and shopping attractions. We could have stayed in Chelsea (especially the Piers) but we walked to the Meatpacking District and also to Greenwich Village, where the Pride March just happened to be taking place. I can't guarantee you will have the same luck or experience as we had staying at the Chelsea, but we made reservations early, and both times we were nothing but overjoyed. My wife had a great Birthday present!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worse”
Reviews.Author: RaeKeva
Reviews.Content: We understood the hotel was historical but historical is not an excuse for plain dilapidated! Our room was RM 105 with double beds and small kitchenette. The room had two large windows, each with a curtain panel. One support for one panel seems to have fallen off so they just had a piece of ply wood nailed to the wall and then the curtain rod attached to the wooden panel. This is the level of repair and maintenance at the hotel. The sink in the kitchenettle leaked as did the toilet. The furniture was old and chipped in many places and the lamp on the night table had no bulbs in it. There were also stains on the upholstery. What made this even worse was that they charge 200/night for this! The room also had an old mouldy smell. Probably on account of lack of propoer ventillation as the room only had a single window unit that was off when we checked in. "Historic" would forgive many other issues I didn't mention but the room was just unkept and unclean. The staff didn't seem surprise we cut our 3 night stay and left ASAP and were helpful in keeping our luggage as we searched for alternate accomadations.

Reviews.Title: “Know What To Expect”
Reviews.Author: NFC36
Reviews.Content: I'm seeing a number of reviews on this site from people who are shocked - SHOCKED! at the type of hotel the Chelsea is. If you don't know the history and reputation of this, one of the most famous hotels on Earth, one cannot have much sympathy for your experiences with broken light bulbs, mustiness, etc. The Chelsea is for the traveller who has more interest in Washington Square than Times Square, more interest in authenticity than tourism. Sure, there are no mints on the pillows in the morning, but the staff here were accomodating, helpful, and curteous. And food from the Donut Plant next door more than made up for the lack of instant breakfasts in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not much to the rooms... But it's the Chelsea!!”
Reviews.Author: Robsbunny
Reviews.Content: Definitely pricey - I think we paid around $285 for our old sparsely furnished room. But it's NYC! What it lacks in luxury it makes up for in character. Staff was pleasant, friendly, helpful, and location was perfect, right in the Chelsea neighbourhood and about a minute walk from the subway. Sweet guitar shop right beside it too.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and funky”
Reviews.Author: BellaMiyagijax
Reviews.Content: We loved the funkiness and the history of the Hotel Chelsea....the location was perfect for our lower Manhattan touring. The staff was awesome...gave us great tips and arranged a wonderful car service to the airport. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible on many fronts, poor value and waste of money.”
Reviews.Author: paintmegrey
Reviews.Content: On the website, there are beautiful photos of rooms. Because of the prices that we were asked to pay ($199 and $279 a night), we thought we would be renting one of those beautiful rooms and were really looking forward to a terrific value. When we get to the hotel the service was horrible. The people behind the counter obviously didn't care about our experience, considering we got there at noon and our rooms weren't ready until 5:30. Due to "cleaning". Either whoever had that room before us had torn it apart, or the people that work at that hotel are lazy. We FINALLY get to our rooms, open the door, and literally stood in silence. The room on the website that was supposed to be the one we rented, was nothing compared to what we were expecting. The room was tiny, nails were sticking out of the wall, a huge amount of mold on the bathroom ceiling, and beat up furniture. The carpets were stained, and the worst part about the entire room was the fact that the smoke detector didn't have batteries. The curtains were torn so you couldn't cover the window completely at night. Just hope that someone in the apartments across from our window wasn't watching. Their internet connection is on average, two bars. Then about every half hour it disconnects and you have to log back on. In our other room, the story is pretty much the same. EXCEPT, the view is of a space about 8' by 8' full of trash. You can get a really good view of it when the sun is directly above it. The fire escapes can only go up, and it is actually and aluminum ladder. And for some reason the air conditioner, that looks out onto the trash pile, doesn't fit in the window. To compensate for the gaping hole in the window, they duct taped a piece of plexiglass to the open window. Unfortunately, only the top. Leaving rats and other critters to feel free to join us at night. Don't worry if you notice that important things, such as fans, air conditioners, and bedroom locks are taped down. Also, just ignore the hanging exposed wires that you find painted over to blend with the wall color. And don't be alarmed when you notice that over the bed frame there are numerous hand prints, and I'm pretty sure I saw a dog paw print too. And for the people who like to unpack their belongings in a dresser, I would advise against it. One: because when I opened the dresser someone had left a note saying how disgusting it was and number Two: they are moldy and the wood is rotting. If you keep your fingers crossed, maybe you will be lucky enough to have a legitimate room number plaque. Otherwise your room number will be stenciled on there for you. Basically, I had high hopes that our experience here would be memorable and unique. They turned out that way.

Reviews.Title: “The Chelsea Hotel is a total and utter sh**hole”
Reviews.Author: culturengine
Reviews.Content: You woud have a better time paying a stranger to steal your luggage than you would staying at the The Chelsea Hotel, so I am posting this to save others from being stuck in this dump. We arrived late, paid in advance at reception and then went upstairs to the room to crash out. It was US$200 a night. The room was tiny, dirty, without a toilet, had a single bed, grotty carpet and rust stains dripping down the in-room sink. At US$20 a night you'd be like, this is sh** but the door has a lock so i will stay until the morning and find another place. At 10 times that price you have no option but to get your money back immediately, which is what we tried to do. We headed straight back downstairs to cancel our booking, but the quality of the reception staff were on par with the room we were given. The staff went as far as to personally insult us for not liking their room. They even seemed to find pleasure in doing so. When we asked for a refund they deferred all responsibility to a general manager named Arnold. Apparently none of the staff can authorise a refund nor contact Arnold to do so. We were told to return 2 days later if we wanted to speak to Arnold. Two days later we revisit the hotel and Arnold is there but won't meet with us, or take a call on his phone. The reception staff on Monday are as useless as they were on Saturday and we waste another hour trying to resolve things. Their callous disregard for service is insane. As soon as they realise you are there with a complaint they walk out of the room or turn away and ignore you. They are the hotel equivalent of a taxi driver who takes your money only to drive you in the opposite direction from where you want to go. We have now taken the matter to Visa to stop the payment and would advise anyone to disregard any positive reviews of this place and avoid it like the plague, as it truly is a total and utter sh**hole.

Reviews.Title: “I remember you well in the Chelsea Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: Leonard Cohen began his song about an encounter with Janis Joplin with these lyrics, and I have wanted to stay in this legendary hotel ever since I first heard the song. There are reports that the historic landmark has been sold, so not knowing what the future holds for the hotel, I wanted to get in before it changes. My stay began on a very positive note with a very friendly desk attendant who invited me to call if I needed anything. In the background I heard another employee on the phone complaining, "Someone's bought the hotel, but we don't know who it is. So we don't know what's going on." I was given a key to suite 1018 on the top floor. I had heard that the hotel was a bit of a dump... not borne out by the somewhat elegant lobby, but the hallways are a bit dingy, and the ceiling is a morass of makeshift wiring and plumbing. My suite was huge, larger than most New York City apartments I've experienced. The walls and ceiling were all covered in odd linen-covered panels that had seen better days. The windows were open when I entered, and the woodwork around them was badly weathered and decayed from exposure. The emerald-green carpet was wrinkled and lumpy, and the big pink lounge/sofa looked right out of the 80s. There was a strange mix of victorian and mid-century modern antiques. The separate kitchen had a gas Jenn-Air stove, but one that was designed to be built-in... this one wasn't. A small refrigerator was placed in a deep pantry, and there was a large piece of specialized wooden furniture, the purpose of which I never discovered. The bathroom appeared to have been tiled in the 70s and featured a built-in harvest-gold tub... with no hot water when I needed it. The linen-paneled walls were badly water-stained in places, and although in a state of disrepair, everything was actually quite clean. The bed itself was amazingly comfortable, and I had an extremely restful sleep... until I heard a pounding noise that sounded like the roof was caving in. It was then that I noticed that a large closet just inside the door had a slanted roof that indicated the bottom of a staircase. So the suite next door must have been some sort of duplex, and every time the residents clomped down the stairs it reverberated through my suite. A large fireplace adorned the main room, containing a few scorched logs. I couldn't tell if the fireplace actually functioned, but there was no warning not to try. It's amazing the place hasn't burned down. I know NYC hotels are expensive, and a place this large is likely a bargain at $325/night, including taxes. I don't regret staying there, but I wouldn't do it again. I know some of my friends would have refused to stay the night because of the state of things. And while the staff were surprisingly friendly to me, there are a number of permanent residents who live at the Chelsea who seem to resent the "tourists" and show open disdain when sharing the elevators and such. If you do stay at the Chelsea, be sure to visit the Doughnut Plant on the street level... best doughnuts in the city! Here's hoping the hotel's next incarnation is worthy of the landmark and its legend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in a Historic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Skimmy21
Reviews.Content: My friend Bob and I stayed in the Chelsea Hotel May 1st-5th... and we had a fantastic time! ALL of the staff (especially Pete when we first checked in and the women we encountered cleaning) were all very friendly and helpful. The location could not have been better - literally steps away from the 1-2-3 train, and the surrounding Chelsea neighborhood was fantastic. We stayed in room 516 - no frills, just a few channels on the TV - but who cares?! You're in NYC! Crazy water pressure in the shower, and the window faced a nice (obviously owner occupied) brick apartment building... wasn't the Manhattan skyline, but rather quintessential New York City. We enjoyed exploring the hotel... the cool art, the decorated doors. The only thing I could've wished for ? Coffee in the lobby... but I understand that there are constantly people going in/out that are not guests of the hotel... If you are expecting The Plaza or even a Holiday Inn, this is not the place for you. If you want to experience one of the nicest neighborhoods in the greatest city in the world... consider this place. The Chelsea Hotel is full of memories and ghosts of genius past...

Reviews.Title: “No Trouble In This Room!”
Reviews.Author: aussienelson
Reviews.Content: Pros: Historic Hotel, with incredible detailing, decorations and overall atmosphere. Cons: You are here for the experience and the ambiance, not the amenities (there are none). Bathroom looks like an off campus apartment (only cleaner). For those seeking the opportunity to say that they stayed in the same hotel as (INSERT famous poet, artist, rock star, etc. HERE) you can do no better on this planet than the Chelsea Hotel. Once a lavish hotel, then a seedy flophouse, and now somewhere gloriously in between: The place is located in the heart of Chelsea. Within 15 minutes on foot, you can get to some great places to eat, and some fun clubs. The subway stop is right there for the E line, but unless it's pouring rain or freezing cold, you would rather walk, because there is always something to look at. The hotel rooms are sparingly adorned: White walls, with a cool painting on one of them. a Circulating fan was a nice touch. The floors were wooden and painted black, which was a nice contrast. I chose the cheapest rate available for a Double ($139 w/shared bath) and that is easily half what most other hotels charge in the city. The bathroom was right on the other side of my room, and other than one guy who showed up in the middle of the night to use it... I never had to wait. Bathroom was clean and the shower was hot with good force. Half the hotels I stay in have a trickle of luke-warm water, and that is what I expected here. Not so! Staying in my room, It was easy to imagine what it was like to be Bob Dylan, strumming a guitar in the '60s, and thinking of his next brilliant song. One room down the hall had an out of tune electric guitar and amplifier in it. They must have imagined what it was like to be Sid Vicious. The sound of the old steam radiator, and the wind rushing through the window I had left open a bit (to cool off the room and keep the air circulating) made for an interesting sound, it lulled me to sleep, actually, and made for some interesting dreams. Everything was very clean, but the walk in closet was hilarious... a primer spattered dresser and old picture hooks, that made me wonder if someone didn't sleep here back in the day... My window had a view of... a brick wall. What do you want for $139? Don't expect to find breakfast in the lobby. There is a donut shop next door for coffee and any kind of food in the world can be found in an instant. CAUTION: There is a thumpy, noisy club underneath the lobby that is open late, so if you want a sounder night's sleep, you might not want to request a room on the first floor. I didn't really notice it too much, and I was on the second floor. But after a night on the town in NYC, I was exhausted. In Short: I imagine I will stay here again sometime in the near-future. The Chelsea is right up there with Hotel 17, represent 2 of the best deals for a hotel with a great history and a lot of character. Stay at either one, and you will brag to your friends how little money you paid to have so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Could hardly find a fault”
Reviews.Author: Nicolajane3
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed for 5 nights mid march 2011. Chose this hotel because of the history and location. It has not has many great reviews so was a little dubious as to what we would walk into. Front desk staff,and all other staff were very helpful and friendly from the moment we arrived to us leaving. The room we had was on the front street next to the neon hotel sign. This was fine though because there was a blackout blind and heavy lined curtains. The bedroom was large with plenty of storage space,bathroom was spacious and bright,kitchenette was an ample size with everything we needed. All these areas were spotless,so we both were pleased. The location was wonderful with several subway lines very close by. Everything you could have needed or wanted was on the block or the next one along.. There are artworks everywhere in the building, it oozes character and felt like a home from home. The price even including taxes was reasonable. My only fault was the street noise at night. Cars ,people, regular stuff. But that is by no means the fault of the hotel. Overall we both loved it here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I Really Wanted To Love It.”
Reviews.Author: FoxAndEgg
Reviews.Content: I am a traveler with a well-developed palate for quirkiness, and so I was ever-so-excited to stay at the famously eclectic Chelsea Hotel. It was so, so lovely. And so, so not. I didn't deal with any of the horror stories described by some other users, but I don't need to stay there again. First, the good: the neighborhood is AWESOME. Chelsea is my preferred neighborhood when I stay in New York, because it's very convenient and central in terms of commuting anywhere in Manhattan, but you could frankly have an awesome vacation without leaving the neighborhood. It's not overly touristy, it doesn't take itself too seriously, and any hotel in walking distance of the Chelsea Market is worth considering, IMHO. If location and vibe are your primary motivators, this hotel might be a contender. That said, here's the review: The good: -room was HUGE -view was interesting -location was amazing. -art was fun -totally eccentric, mentally stimulating, and giggle-inducing -full kitchen would have been great if I'd used it The comical: -smelled like pot resin -Some kind of chant circle/massive incense burning went on for hours on our first evening there. It was fun to wonder what it was all about, but then, I'm a generally good sport. -REALLY smelled like pot resin. The bad: -Drippy stains on mantle of fireplace from god-knows-what -World's loudest radiators -Flamingoes on the clear plastic shower curtain -When they repaint, they don't bother scraping off the old, peeling paint/wallpaper/dried god-knows-what. Nope. They just paint right over it, creating an interesting...texture... All in all, I am glad I stayed there, because I've wondered for years what all the chatter was about. I never felt grossed out, encountered any roaches or bedbugs, or had bad service. But then, I have a strong stomach, a sense of humor, and I went in with an understanding that the Chelsea is all about the kitsch. If you're looking for luxury, then, well...there are better places in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Chelsea.”
Reviews.Author: MyselfYourself
Reviews.Content: I love Chelsea so find it hard to rate the Chelsea Hotel badly. So I won't, nor I can't. Book early and you can pick up a good room (with a bathroom) for $140 AUD per night. The rooms aren't flash but they are full of character and make staying at the Chelsea Hotel a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worse dump in New York City”
Reviews.Author: Surfingirl056
Reviews.Content: Snobby front desk clerk, room was a joke. Afraid to sleep on bed for fear of bed bugs. The so called kitchen was a joke. Bathroom was dirty. One nite was enough. Slept with one eye open for rats. Worse place I ever stayed at and I have travelled the world.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: phoebewanders
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that the Hotel Chelsea is one of those places that people either love or hate. I happen to love it. It is so much more than just a place to sleep, it is an experience in and of itself. I have stayed at the Chelsea twice (so far...). The first time was with my sister in law. We had a room on the back side of the hotel. At one time Leonard Cohen had also stayed in our room which if you know any of the history of the hotel is kind of a cool little trivia fact. We got a double room with kitchenette. The room was huge! We had two double beds, a dresser, a table with chairs, a vanity table, a kitchenette with stove, sink, mini fridge, cabinets. The room was so large in fact that there was a hallway with a closet leading to the bathroom. All of this for $149 a night (note - the prices of the rooms seem to flucuate with the seasons, we were there in March). Being on the backside of the hotel the room was very quiet. The only sounds we heard were an occasional piano tune making it's way from somewhere else in the hotel and the sounds of the pipes gurgling through the radiators at night. The hotel is actually more of an apartment building rather than a hotel with most of it's rooms having permanent residents. As a result there are sounds of life throughout the building (such as the piano that we heard) and the occasional conversation in the hallway. For me and for my sister in law that is part of the charm. On my second stay at the Chelsea I was again with my sister in law and for one night my niece and her boyfriend stayed with us. We got another double with a kitchenette, this time on the front of the hotel. The room that we stayed in on this visit had once belonged to Edie Sedgewick, one of Andy Warhols factory girls. This room was slightly smaller but still a very good size. And being at the front of the hotel we had access to the iron balcony outside of our window. There were more traffic noises and alot of street noise especially since auditions for Last Comic Standing were taking place and there were folks lined up and camping out outside on the sidewalk for days (the Gotham Comedy Club is right next door). But hey, this is New York City and if a little noise is going to bother you it may not be the right city for you to visit. We loved climbing out on the balcony in the morning and at the end of the night and watching the crowds and the people walking by. Another plus of this hotel to me is the amazing artwork. The lobby is filled with it as is almost every hallway of every floor. If you take the elevator to the top and then walk down you will feel like you're in a secret art gallery. You also never know just what might be going on at any given time. Our room on our second visit was still in the process of having furniture returned to it as we were walking in because it had just been used the day before for filming a scene for Law & Order with Jeff Goldblum. It was alot of fun when the episode aired to see "our" room on tv. I can't wait to visit New York again this fall and to stay at the Hotel Chelsea for a third time. If you like history, rock n roll, eccentric characters, and out of the ordinary experiences then this may be the place for you. Keep in mind though that they do not offer breakfast (but there are plenty of places to get a bagel nearby), there are no vending machines or room service or fitness equipment or a pool and your key to your room is still an actual key, not a key card, that is kept behind the desk when you leave for the day. But if you're like me and have always wanted to live like a resident of the places that you visit and not just stay at another cookie cutter hotel than I think you will enjoy the Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again for free”
Reviews.Author: nycdiva2010
Reviews.Content: Two of my friends and a parent came to New York for NYU open house. Having been to the city multiple times I have come to expect a certain quality of hotel for the price. Walking up to the room the walls were dingy and the whole place smelled like pot. We got into the room and it was very very small. There was no bathroom in the room...there was only a community bathroom in the hallway. One disgusting shower and one toilet to share with the other guests on the floor. The beds were uncomfortable and as we were laying down to sleep we found PUBIC hairs in the sheets. We went down to report this to the front desk who then had house keeping bring us new sheets. The new ones ALSO had pubic hairs stuck to them. We were booked to stay for two nights but couldn't bear to stay the second. We went down to the front desk to complain and told them we weren't staying out second night because of our extreme dissatisfaction. He told us "good luck finding another hotel" as it was during some sort of festival and all of the hotels had been booked. We didn't get our money back nor was any manager ever available to speak with. I wouldn't stay here again if it was the last available hotel in NYC and it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable find with No Frills.”
Reviews.Author: Bellerio2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. The Front Desk staff is very nice and accommodating. It is affordable without all the frills (no breakfast, no room service). The rooms can either be one of the renovated ones or really dumpy. So when booking, you get what you pay for. The higher the rate, the nicer the room. The suites are fabulous and a great value for the money. Very spacious for NY and renovations were nicely done. Bear in mind that this hotel has residents. An interesting twist. If you want to get a great burger or sloppy Joe's, check out Trailer Park across the street close to 9th Avenue. Cool bar and absolutely delicious food at a great price. The margarita pitchers weren't so bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, its a little dirty. But its also fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: lissab82
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea is a great place for those of us concerned with having authentic experiences. Each floor is special, tons of fabulous art, wrought iron staircases, and tons of hidden treasures behind closet doors and cubby holes. If you want one of the rooms featured on the website, you have to specifically request one. The other rooms are threadbare, with very limited features. But who cares? You are right on 23rd street! The dirt on the window sills has probably been there since Sid allegedly killed Nancy, but thats part of the charm. Plus for the location, is affordable. If you want luxury, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “An enjoyable stay in a clean, spacious room. No problems whatsoever.”
Reviews.Author: frequent_flier_0813
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Chelsea Hotel, shortly before Christmas 2010, was absolutely perfect. The entire building has a slightly faded bohemian charm, but I encountered absolutely *none* of the problems other reviewers apparently did. My room was clean and spacious (I checked thoroughly for bedbugs and traces of cockroaches), the mattress was new, the sheets clean and crisp. The room had a large table and chairs, a big funky fireplace, and a clean, newish bathroom. The service at the front desk was somewhat abrupt, but in a playful New York kind of way. I certainly wouldn't accuse others of misrepresenting their experiences, but I was left wondering if we were talking about the same hotel. The only minor complaint I can register is that the windows didn't close tightly and there was a slight draft during the night. If you want 5-star luxury, this isn't the place. No marble in the bathroom, no flat-screen TVs, no slippers with the hotel's name embroidered across the toes... But if you want an economical room in a cool part of town, in a building filled with charm and history, the Chelsea Hotel fits the bill. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy Rooms, Rude Staff, and cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: joelchip
Reviews.Content: This may be a NYC landmark having hosted several celebrities from the 60's and 70's. However, that was also the last time they cleaned, painted and repaired this insanely filthy property. There were tiles missing in the 'kitchenette' with encrusted food filling in the space. Stains of who knows what dripping down the walls, window air conditioner was hanging half out the window ready to fall. And the topping on this cake is cockroaches. The incredibly rude staff refused to refund my credit card imprint, stating we had to speak to the 'accountant'. I had to file a complaint with Visa since there no 'accountant' seems to exist and they won't refund the nights stay. Do yourself a favor and stay next door at the Chelsea Savoy or up the street at the Affinia.

Reviews.Title: “Artsy Fartsy”
Reviews.Author: franci329
Reviews.Content: Really should have read the reviews before booking this hotel. pics online look great. I reserved a 2 doubles with kitchen. What did I get? When we arrived you walk into a pretty cool looking lobby with lots of art and I thought it was cool and kindy spooky that Sid Vicious had killed his girlfriend in room 100. who knew? We were in room 126. Anyways, Jason at the desk tells me there is a little problem. They overbooked the hotel and now they only have 1 queen room available. I don't mind sleeping with my girlfriends but this was just not good. We got to the room and the bed was at least 6 inches off the floor, no amenities, no pictures on the walls and the bellmen says " you have 28 channels on your tv" wippee. Look out the window to barbwire. I didn't feel safe at all. Called housekeeping for extra pillows got them 1 hr later.The best part is, there's a club on the first floor and at 6am all you hear is techno music. I'd like to sleep at that time. Oh, they did offer 15% because they overbooked the rooms. Still, not worth $300+ dollars. Would I stay again. No

Reviews.Title: “Artsy, Convenient, Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crocon
Reviews.Content: Historic, classic hotel with unique architectural style ... this hotel offers convenience, decent pricing (for NYC), and art just about everywhere. The room was nothing special, somewhat clean but certainly not immaculate, but capacious enough and comfortable. No special room amenities were offered but none were sought either. It worked for a weekend trip, offered the convenience of the trendy Chelsea location and is within walking distance of many night spots, trendy clubs, music venues and restaurants. The subway is right around the corner so public transportation is a cinch. I'd stay here again but I'd look for other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Great nostalgia hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ginsberg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel which breaths the authentic a(r)tmosphere of the old days. A great spot if you don't need additional luxuries, why should you when you are in the heart of the Big Apple. It's amazing to know you sleep at the place with a history like this! Rooms look dated (authentic if you now about the history of the hotel) but are nice and clean. Beds are good. Location is very good for discovering Manhattan, with the subway on 23rd street. Wireless Internet is not great but hey. Staff is helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS IN HOTEL CHELSEA”
Reviews.Author: discospeed
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience here. Checked into room 436, got back to hotel first night at around 12. Noticed a huge insect crawl on bed, which i promptly threw into bin. Then another one 30 minutes later, which i threw into trash again. i had checked the bed properly and couldnt see any signs so wasnt sure, but was totally freaked out. At 3am i called room service and they placed me in a much larger room on 1st floor. Woke up next morning covered in bites on my arm and back, which really freaked me out. Threw oout most of clothes and bought some new ones. Left for Canada and totally paranoid i brought them home, though i took all precautions. Hotel refunded entire stay, but only when i showed them the bites covering my arm. Not good. Do not stay here, regardless of price its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great character and history - Well worth it (if you get a good room)”
Reviews.Author: Canon_Doc
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading about it in the Rough Guide - a New York landmark with many notable previous residents (Arthur C Clarke, Dylan Thomas etc). Sounding intriguing and interesting and after a little effort convinced the girlfriend this was a superior choice to the similarly priced Hilton. Location - Chelsea. Safe area with a few decent restaurants and cafes nearby. Excellent for the Metro with the main lines running to stations 2 mins walk away. Hotel itself - with the history and heritage, certainly a lot to live up to. The lobby doesn't disappoint with great art on the wall. Friendly helpful staff. Room (queen size) - admittedly drab but characterful with original fittings. The old carpet, grey with a couple of dubious stains. Windows although able to close fully were single glazed and quite drafty. Even with heavy curtains and the radiator on full blast nights were a chilly affair. Given the expense of the room I felt this was unacceptable and made a complaint - the same day we were upgraded to a lovely room with king size bed, wooden floor and non drafty windows! Very very nice indeed and the next 5 nights were a delight. With the poor room I'd consider this a 3/5 overall and consider myself somewhat shortchanged in the value stakes and honestly would struggle to recommend it. With the nice room I'd consider this a 4/5 overall and would certainly recommend. If you want an interesting stay in a hotel full of history this is your choice. Be wary regarding the variability of the rooms. Also note no breakfast at the hotel, but free wifi is included.

Reviews.Title: “one word unique”
Reviews.Author: SOMELIKEITHOT47
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the chelsea hotel for 4 nights It was my idea because it was one of those places which for a long time i always wanted to stay at reading about all of the history and events and well known people who have stayed there etc On arrival we entered the lobby were there the decor is appealing to the eye very artistic and lots of quirky objects We stayed on the very top floor at the back of the hotel and the view was great The room we stayed in was clean but very basic with very old furniture and fittings but the bedding was clean and the bed was old but comfortable ( i can only vouch this for the room i stayed in ) Me and my partner both enjoyed how stay at the chelsea hotel and was sad to leave and would defintly stay there again not because its the best hotel in the world but its the chelsea unique Tips if booking a room and you want to book the suit the posh looking one shown on there web page then please make sure you insist by no no condition any thing other than that room shell do!! because we booked a suite for 4 nights and never got it just another room with out a explanation which was bye no means any thing like the one on the web page but on check out thy only charged us for 3 nights stay instead of 4 so swings and round abouts Tip 2 take the stairs from the lobby to the top floor and look at all the art work on the walls don't be scared to look around the corridors Tip 3 expect the worst and you will not be disappointed it is the Chelsea hotel and not the plaza hotel you will love it or hate

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it! So many issues, cockroaches, dirty, sunken mattresses....”
Reviews.Author: Likemyhats
Reviews.Content: Don't do it! So many issues, cockroaches, dirty, sunken mattresses, dimly lit hallways and staircases, no TV signal, insecure and slow internet, tiny elevator, rude staff, and more, are burned into my memory. I emailed them to check the rates on my way there and was told $239 but when I arrived 2 hours later the rate was $269 and the desk clerk had the nerve to stoop to name-calling, using profanity toward me when I was leaving. I wouldn't wish a stay at this hotel for my worst enemy. So be safe and stay anywhere else!! What I liked the best - I didn't have to sleep on the streets.

Reviews.Title: “Classic!”
Reviews.Author: txslk
Reviews.Content: It was very awesome to stay at Hotel Chelsea. If you are going looking for updated, super clean, great food...keep on looking! The Chelsea is artsy, old and has so much character. The history in this place is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “A piece of history...Nothing fancy but better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: Metsts41
Reviews.Content: For so many years when I've stayed in Manhattan, I have passed this place in awe of the history, but never stayed there until earlier this year. I was a little leery because of the age, but this was an AMAZING place. From the moment you enter the lobby and observe the art work that continues through the hallways and up the stairs, you know this is old school. And that was fine with me, it was what I was hoping for. When we checked in we could hear a musician practicing through the walls, but that was just for a little while. We had a balcony facing 23rd Street that was amazing to be out on and take it all in. There was a full kitchen, refirgerator, sink etc that we did not use because it was just an overnighter. The appliances were a bit dated, but seemed to be fully operational. The staff was pleasant, though I didn't deal with them that much. The location was steps from the subway and buses, couldn't ask for anything more. If you don't mind an older place with nothing fancy, give this place a try

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected and more.”
Reviews.Author: sjtruman
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea obviously has a lot of history, and I would expect that most of it's guests are people who are aware of that fact and are interested in the hotel for that reason. We purposefully booked two reservations during our stay so that we could experience two different rooms (no two rooms in the hotel are alike!) and we were glad we did. The first room was a double. It had lots of art from previous residents, which was cool. It was a little run down, but the hotel is one of the oldest buildings in Manhattan, so what do you expect?! The bed and bathroom were completely clean, so no complaints. The view of Chelsea was awesome. The second room we booked was a queen, but they didn't have one available, to they gave us a king sized bed for the same price! That room was soooooo beautiful. It was the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed in (mind you, I'm not rich). The staff at the Chelsea are incredibly helpful and professional. The location of the hotel is right smack in the middle of Manhattan, and there is a subway stop about a block away. Great pizza on the corner of 23rd and 8th. The art in the lobby and the hallways of the Chelsea alone is worth the stay. I loved it and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fun but dirty”
Reviews.Author: Mezz0
Reviews.Content: I knew it wouldn't be clean before I got there but somehow that didn't prepare me for the omminous brown stains on the walls, dirty floor and ceilings. At a time of bed-bugs this is not what you want to see. Cool to some extent - but more historical feeling. Go to Brooklyn if you want cool (although very easy to get to Bedford Ave from here on tube). I was hoping to see someone interesting in the lift but saw mostly lost -looking tourists, a lady with tiny dogs, drunk teenage types and a tatooed man. Our room faced out onto a sad, grey courtyard from whence the sound of air-conditioners eminated. I wondered if this view was sufficiently inspiring for the artists living upstairs. On our last night (incidentally and unfortunately the night before an important work thing for me) a host of drunken students moved into the room next to us. They made me feel old. And kept me awake til near 6am. My advice is this: if you've reached 30 and realise you like things clean, (like, clean enough to comfortably put your feet on the floor) and quiet after 1am, stay away. If you're near student age, wealthy, like to party and still wonder what the point of dusting is, stay here. It's essentially a youth hostel, if a VERY expensive one. In fact you might try the Carlton Arms Hotel for a cheaper version of this. And Brits - don't forget the freakin taxes. I nearly choked on my latte when I saw all the bonkers extra tax-related costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Decor, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Rosebush86
Reviews.Content: I was traveling for business the entire week before Labor Day weekend and my last stop was in Pittsburgh before I was supposed to head back to LA. I decided to make a pitstop in New York City instead so that I could spend Labor Day weekend there with my boyfriend. After a HUGE headache and trying to find hotel rooms for under $500 per night (we booked a couple weeks before) I called a hotel-finding website for assistance. She referred me to Chelsey Hotel which fit in my budget (I only wanted to spend about $600 total for two weekends). She said it was a boutique hotel right by Times Square. Sure enough, Friday morning comes and my boyfriend and I get to NYC around 9am - SEVERAL hours before check in at 3pm and we are exhausted. We asked if there was anyway that we could check in early and THEY LET US! WITH NO ADDITIONAL CHARGE. Setting aside the fact that we stepped into an art gallery (literally the hotel is THAT cool) they were friendly and checked us in SO early. Although the room was a little plain (no art on the walls in the rooms) it was clean and EXACTLY what we needed. Our stay overall was GREAT. We checked in SUPER early, we were maybe 10-15 minutes walking from Times Square and we had NO noise problems when trying to get to sleep. I would DEFINITELY recommend to people on a budget who want to stay at a decent hotel near Times Square. Like I said, GREAT location, GREAT decor and GREAT price!!

Reviews.Title: “A Fraud a, but a cool one.”
Reviews.Author: kiwijj
Reviews.Content: Yes, there is a great history and some cool funky art. And yes, It's an experience. Especially if you're young and un-fussy about cleanliness, security and websites which lie.The photographs are utterly fraudulent. My room was appalling. The wireless internet (which I need and paid for) is so insecure it seriously threatens your system. I had to shut down immediately and head for the nearest Starbucks. Real cockroaches (dead ones cheerfully left behind AFTER the cleaner had gone). Window onto the fire escape didn't close, smoke alarm ripped off the wall, bare light bulbs and yards of exposed wiring. I could go on. Photos attached. I slept in my clothes. Read the blogs for more history and stay there if you want to part of the vibe, but if you're paying for a clean, comfortable and safe place - not here.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel should be on everyone's bucket list!”
Reviews.Author: Lmitchell59
Reviews.Content: If you go for the vibe, the art, the worn down marble stair treads, the history, the view up the open stairwell, and the pretty great location, the Chelsea Hotel will not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP!!”
Reviews.Author: Brantae
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor and just skip this place. It's gross. My door didn't lock. I asked for a new room and they wouldn't do it. Would have been nice that they let you know there is no air in the room. I opened the balcony door to let air in and the railing dividing my neighbor was torn down. Try sleeping in NYC in summer with no air and now the window closed. The guy next to me could just walk right on over. Not safe and very dirty. Spend more and be comfortable. I think a subway would be more secure and more comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fell In Love With The Place”
Reviews.Author: NYCLVR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the second week in July. (Me & my husband). I know and LOVE the history of the hotel, thats why we stayed here. The staff were VERY friendly and helpful. The location is close to everything, we spent most of our time at Times Square, about a 5 minute cab ride away. Our room was very clean. If you are looking for room service and mints on your pillow, this is not the hotel for you. If you know the history, you will fall in love with the place! It was so much better than I expected. We are going back real soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, historic and worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Julie_c2003
Reviews.Content: Despite several dodgy reviews on trip advisor our experience was amazing. Yes the systems went down at check in meaning we had to wait a while, but the staff went out of their way to help and in the end we scored the best room in the hotel, so no wonder we're happy. Our room had recently been renovated and was on the 10th floor. Not quite what I expected as parquet floors, chrome fridge, modern kitchen and bathroom, flat screen TV. The stairwells are full of amazing art, cool characters hanging around in every corner. If you are looking for bell boys, room service, gym etc...this is not the place for you, however if you want history, cool characters, SPACE (compared to the other hotel we'd been in this is like a palace) and charm...highly recommend staying here. Can't believe expedia have down graded it to a two star. Not in our experience. Don't go to the ribs place a couple of doors down though. Got a slight touch of food poisoning. Great little gay bar a few doors up on the left, friendly to those who are not gay as well.

Reviews.Title: “Drugs needed to stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LA_Btrfly
Reviews.Content: You have to really be smoking something to want to come back to this place. We looked at the hotels website and we feel we have been a victim of a bait and switch scam! Online the hotel seemed nice and artistic, and upon arriving, we thought it to be different and unique. That is until we got out of the taxi and what appeared to be the mantenance man was out front taunting a young lady walking by. The door man didn't offer to help with our luggage, then mantenance man from out side came through the door and started yelling across the lobby at what appeared to be a resident of the hotel. And the cranky old man behind the desk was rude to us for no reason at all. We was shown to our room, exiting the elevator we were slapped with the stale smell of smoke and the door man blatenly lied saying that Chub Rock used to stay in the exact room we were assigned. I don't doubt he may have stayed there, but I don't believe it was THAT room. The door did not fit the frame, the beds were saggy and grungy, the "kitchenette" was very sad looking and not anywhere I would want to prepare anything I would put in my mouth. There was no flat screen TV, the dressers was missing the drawer pulls and the carpet looked as if half of NY had walked all over them. It felt like we was in the twilight zone! I didn't want to touch the bed, let alone lay on it, I was sure it was covered with bed bugs and any other bacteria my imagination could congure up. And although my fiancee and I was extremely tired from our red-eye flight, and our eyes burning and body was screaming for rest, we immediately pulled out our laptop and found another hotel to go to. We were there less than an hour and they still charged us for a full night. Needless to say, we would never recommend or suggest the Chelsea Hotel to anyone else. Maybe they do have nicer rooms and maybe the staff are friendly, but from our experience, we didn't see or get that impression at all. If you choose to stay there I say do so at your own risk, (from all the other reviews) it's a roll of the dice! You'd definitely have to be smoking, snorting or injecting some kind of drug to call this place a 3,4, or 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If your idea of "Bohemian" is Pier One, you won't like it.”
Reviews.Author: voco
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel! How could you not? First, the common areas are really interesting from the funky lobby to the beautiful staircase and the art on every wall. Unlike the other reviews here, we found the hotel staff to be very friendly. Our room was spartan but serviceable. Although, I would not say that it was super clean. The appeal for us was the hotel's interesting history and unique decor. Good restaurants are very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much and you may like it.”
Reviews.Author: SummerSnowbird
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel in beginning October 2008. The lobby is an experience because of the variety of people passing by. The room wasn't nice at all and in bad shape, decor dating of early '60s. The room was a bit dusty like in an old country house, but there was enough space to be comfortable and the linens were clean. Mattresses were comfrotable. We were there for 2 days, and didn't intent to spend our time in the hotel at all, so it didn't really matter to us. We couldn't careless about the hotel's history, which basically is all it has to sell besides its outstanding location. The service has been very kind with us. The main reason to like the Chelsea, if you are to like it, is that it's like an improvised place to stay. You have all kind of people passing around, modern art paintings and drawings and there is a little chaos that can have it's charm, making you feel like if you were inside an odd comedy movie. The location is absolutely perfect. Nothing is really far from there, and if it is, it's an easy subway-bus ride anyway. There are good restaurants around, from simple to expansive, and you can find about anything you need close to there. If you don't expect much more than a clean bed to sleep in and a shower where you're not afraid to wash yourself, you may like the Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “Don't let it's history fool you into thinking it's still cool - it's a dump.”
Reviews.Author: AVOIDCHELSEAHOTEL
Reviews.Content: We booked in to the Chelsea Hotel, New York, for one night only. Thank God. The hotel is grubby, uninviting and DISAPPOINTING! We had previously spent 6 nights at the Hilton Garden Inn on Eighth Avenue which was fantastic, and had booked the Chelsea as a special treat when passing through NY again a week later. The lobby is a bit dull but I remained stubbornly optimistic. The guy who checked us in might have walked in off the street just ahead of us. Far from a uniform, these hip, trendy and rude receptionists wear what they like. Our guy had seriously ripped jeans and a seriously bad attitude. He reluctantly began to deal with us then welcomed an opportunity to disappear to deal with another customer, perhaps a regular or long-term resident who definitely merited an improvement in attitude! On his return we were begrudgingly handed a key for Room 112. When we enquired about a left-luggage facility for the following day we were told "Yes, that's possible, two dollars per bag". With the rates they charge, they still find it necessary to charge two dollars per bag! We trundled up to Room 112 and I could not believe the sight that greeted my eyes. The carpet is ancient and looks filthy. There is one bedside locker, nothing on the other side of the bed. A flat-screen TV is available all right, but sits on top of an ancient tallboy in a room that makes you want to spend as little time in it as possible. The bathroom was tired-looking, not officially dirty but not appealing either. The shelves in the bathroom and the bedroom have peeling paint and believe me, you don't want to unpack your suitcase in this room. We were left with an ear-bud belonging to a previous (the previous?) guest in the bathroom and an oddment of plastic packaging sitting in front of the TV. I guess this place was once glamorous but the management evidently want us to see it EXACTLY how it used to be – no modernisation or modern standards of cleaning to bring you to the present day. The curtains don't fully close either, and the view is of a slightly grim back yard. The one thing I have to acknowledge is an enormous bed - we both got a good night's sleep, once we got over wondering how long the bed had been there and if the covers were hygienic... Final insult is that you have to check out by 11am - isn't there a universal hotel standard of midday? I didn't even want to hang around to put on my face - we showered gingerly and got out of there as soon as we could. We certainly weren't looking for any breakfast thank you. On checking out I was very tempted to ask if our room was typical of Chelsea Hotel standard and tell them it was appalling, but I didn't. Why not? I guess it's because there were other people checking out and the staff were so disinterested that I felt I would only be laughed at anyway – we decided we had better chalk it down to experience and try to forget it as soon as possible. Location of this hotel is "good" in that it's near the subway, but Chelsea itself is rather dingy and down at heel. I kept looking for the hidden charm but if it was there at all it was well and truly hidden! And to put this in context - we paid almost 300 dollars for this dingy room, by the time you take the room rate plus tax plus city charges etc etc etc the final rate is a lot more than it seems! And the REAL sting in the tail was that despite paying in full in advance through hotels.com, we discovered on our return home that we had been charged the full rate AGAIN by the Chelsea! Seeing as they never actually had a conversation with us when we checked out but merely relieved us of our room key, we had no idea they were going to apply the charge to our card. After a few phonecalls ("Accounts isn't open, I don't have the authority to deal with this" was the first response) we were assured the amount would be refunded and it was within the week. However I've seen enough comments in other Chelsea Hotel reviews to make me think this is their standard practice - a lot of posts advise to "double check" your bill, we certainly would have had we been presented with one!" All in all it was certainly "the hotel stay that stays with you, for the wrong reasons".

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel you just have to”
Reviews.Author: Lyntin
Reviews.Content: Ok not the greatest hotel in the world but charming all the same. Great building and you really know you are in New York. Art every where and I loved the staircase.

Reviews.Title: “This place has Character”
Reviews.Author: ahhdrjones
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed at the Chelsea on the tenth floor for three nights. Our room was full of character with all red furniture and walls. The Hotel is over 100 years old so it has some wear and tear but that did not detract from the charm. The hotel has catered to a eclectic mix of tenants and hotel stayers and was always buzzing with activity. The Owner personally checked in with us and was very hospitable. The location of the hotel was perfect for our trip since we were frequenting the Meat Packing District and the East Village throughout the week.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, NEVER, NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: susiemae
Reviews.Content: I agree with everyone on their reviews and can add even more! I TOTALLY agree with the fact that the shady characters at the front desk were rude, unhelpful , and their best attribue was ignoring us! The bed was on the floor,,my bedside light didn't work...no plug next to bed, but it looked good though!! the room had no pictures on the walls, no mirror, no ironing board, or iron and no hair dryer!!!!!! I NOT only did not put on make-up in the morning, I wouldn't even shower!!!Y Hopped on the train, and got out of NYC as fast as I could...only when we could wake up the desk clerk to check us out!!. I too was given the "email" for the manager who was at a meeting, then was on vacation...depended on whom you asked...everyone tried to pass on your request to someone else, until you were ignored again.....A FIRE TRAP WAITING TO HAPPEN!! OH..One more thing. Pray you don't have an emergency in this plush Hotel. the phone didn't work in the room. No matter what button you pushed..it rang busy. So..you hve to run downstairs and stand waiting for the shady looking to finish ignoring you. We asked for 2 more pillows at 3:30p,m.. Got back to room at 11:30p.m.GUESS WHAT??????? YOU GOT IT...NO PILLOWS. An experience we could have done without. It has only provided us with a few good laughs, the chance to tell everyone where not to stay, and @ $225 less dollars!! AND PLEASURE THAT WE ARE NOT THE ONLY ONES THAT FEEL THE SAME WAY ABOUT THIS PLACE!! (Thanks Grubby!!)

Reviews.Title: “live like a NYC resident................if you can”
Reviews.Author: travel_trixi
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea Hotel is just not for every one. The people working there are all toughies and the place is like an apartment building more then a hotel. We changed 2 rooms in 4 days mainly because the evening staff does not know what the morning staff is doing or saying. People are not very friendly and they keep you in line, reminding you with the tone of voice or the body language (mostly big tall guys work there, only 1 woman and they have no name taggs) that you are "The guest" We did get back into the New York toughness of people dealing with each other while staying there. The rooms are very different, some with new bathrooms, but old mattress, some with outside bathroom from the 1950's but the bed was good, the towels were changes dayly and were plenty. The paint or furniture is not even worth discussing, very " basic" and old, the wall to wall carpet is old and not so clean, to say the least. The location is very good, many famous people lived there and still do- you feel like you live in NY because the area is mostly residential with lots of stores, flower shops, diners, restaurants and the subway (line 1) is just around the corner. The price is also cheap compared to the other places in NYC, Check your bill carefully when you check out..........

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel Adrift”
Reviews.Author: papavudu
Reviews.Content: Everything you have and will read about The Chelsea Hotel is true. It is an iconic, grand old boehmian building dripping in art, history and mysterious alure. It's also a dump with plaster/paint falling off the walls, wood trim rotted around the windows and clean only by the standards of a well dosed junkie. It also seems a bit unsafe. Though there is a dramatic stair well for easy egress in the event of an emergency, the place seems like a tinder box that could go up at any time. I can overlook the cleanliness, I can dismiss the indifferent front desk clerks and I can overlook the fact that I am pretty sure the guy in the room next to me was a drug dealer. But, what I simply can't forgive is being totally ignored. When I arrived I pulled my car up in front of the hotel, took out my bag and walked into the lobby telling the front desk I had a car outside. No problem, everything cool, I left the keys went to my room relaxed a bit, changed and left for a little imbibement. My car was gone. The next morning I phoned the front desk and asked for the car to be brought around. Car came around and low and behold had a $120 NYC parking ticket from the day before. No worries says the valet, take it to the front desk. I did, they took it. A month or so later, a letter arrived from the NYC Parking Authority demanding payment. This starts the adventure of trying to find someone in charge, someone willing to take care of it or even telling me to go to hell......but no. I am ignored, I am dispatched to a voicemail so full it will know longer take messages. Finally, I reach the mysterious "Arnold" who seems to be the only one capable/able to help. I get an email address, progress!! Suffice it to say I just paid the $120 ticket after months of wrangling with the Chelsea and NYC. Now, I know this sounds a bit whiny, but what if I had a real problem? For as much as I wanted to like this hotel, as much as I wanted to stay again and explore, this place is simply an old vessel with no direction and nobody at the healm. It's sad, really.

Reviews.Title: “Full of hisotry and charactor”
Reviews.Author: LollipopHead
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Chelsea for 5 nights on a break in New York. Our room was next to the sign at the front of the hotel but the room had thick black out curtains. The room was a bit noisy being on a main road but we didn't pick this hotel for peace and quiet. We chose this hotel for it's place in NY histroy and all the remarkable people who have stayed there in the past. The hotel is a beautiful old building full of fantastic art. Our room was nice and comfortable with a good bathroom and kitchenette. On Sunday morning we couldn't get any hot water from the shower but every other time the water was hot. I loved my stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Chelsea Hotel Hell!”
Reviews.Author: Zutty
Reviews.Content: At first glance, the New York City's Chelsea Hotel looks like something out of "A Streetcar Named Desire;" scruffy, well beyond its prime, dirty, and worn down. The brooding men (one would be hard pressed to call them "staff,") cowering around the front desk look like they have gone or could go a couple of rounds with Stanley Kowalski. They are more like bouncers than staff. And, while they may know the history of the place (a few may have lived it) their attitude is confrontational rather than welcoming and terse rather than congenial. Every time I approached them I felt that I was bothering them. I suppose this attitude derives from the somewhat constant flow of guests who voice complaints (for example, as I waited to check in one bouncer was belittling a guest who was checking out with language that guaranteed he would not consider returning while another clerk tried to explained to a young lady why her room phone didn't work). Our family stay in Hotel Hell started as soon as we walked into our room; dirty, dirty, dirty! I felt as though I was at a CSI crime scene — everywhere I looked I wanted to spray a white circle around the smudges, thick layers of dust and grime, unidentified toilet stuff, and especially the broken, filthy, blinds. One can only imagine what was hidden unseen on the bedspread. Yuck! We should have left but we had booked two rooms for a family of six and we weren't about to go hotel looking again. We would put up with this but were really tested. Here is a brief list of what we encountered; - The old TV worked but we didn't get very many channels (we could see the channels but the screen was "blocked out." didn't someone pay the bill? -the bathroom faucet ran constantly throughout our stay. - Sunday morning at 8am I asked for extra towels three times by going down to the front desk. After waiting a half hour more I found that the housekeeping staff (which consisted of one elderly woman) didn't show up until 9am. The desk clerk brought the tows up and at 9:15 housekeeping brought up another set. - We went sightseeing for the rest of the day and returned to the room around 6pm to rest before going out to dinner. Bam! A live rock band began playing directly below our room at such a level the floor was shaking (across the hall, another guest said "everything in her room was shaking.") It would not have been so bad if they knew what they were doing but, not only were they very loud, they only knew three chords (I though Punk went out in the late 70s!). I went to the front desk to ask one of the bouncers to ask the group to stop but was told there was nothing that could be done, even if they called the police (evidentially, they had tried this on other Sundays). The bouncer told be they would stop after 30 minutes. An hour later they were still playing. - I said I would not pay the bill and the "manager" said he was sorry and that he would change our room and reduce the cost by $50. We denied the room change since we were ready to go out but we would accept the $50 deduction. When we checked out no one behind the desk had any knowledge of this. I finally convinced them and they deducted $50 from my bill. -When we arrived, we had to tote all of our luggage to our room so I wasn't surprised when we had to lug it to the lobby ourselves before we checked out. Getting our car was also interesting; I called the number on our car claim check and when I asked if they would bring the car to the front of the hotel, they told me that I would have to pick up the car myself at a location four blocks away. I then called the front desk and was told that my car would be delivered to the hotel. It was. Clearly, this hotel has some serious problems but the main issue here is that there doesn't seem to be anyone running the place. If you like that sort of thing, go, but you would be better off staying away.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel stay ever”
Reviews.Author: moe303
Reviews.Content: i decided to take my family to New York for a trip. i looked through several online travel companies and i located the Hotel Chelsea in New York. i looked online for information on the hotel and was satisfied with the online information. but< everything changed once i arrived. i was greated with a dirty lobby and extremely rundown front desk. I had paid approximately $375.00 for a room with two queen size beds which i was given. i then went up to the third floor where i had to practicaly pry the room door open. as i entered the room o was discusted at what i saw. Just to give you an idea , the room was rundown and looked as if it was built in the 1800's. anywhere you looked you would be able to find dust. The weather was kind of warme to i attempted to turn on the window a/c unit was i was not able to tell where the power button was becaused of the age and ware on the unit. At the same time, my son did the first thing that children do when they get to a hotel, turn on the tv. my son then tells me that the t.v. was not turning on. i attempted to turn the t.v. on via the remoteand that did not work. I then attempted to turn the tv om manualy and that did not work. at the same time my wife call me to the bathroom and showed me where the laziest housekeeper in the world was assigned to the past several months. at this point i was upset and attempted to contact the front desk but the telephone in the room was not working. i then went down the elevator to the front desk where i spoke to a person called "juny". i expressed my concerns and was advised that the hotel was booked but woul be able to provide me with another room sometime after 9 p.m.. Naturely i responded to the front desk and was advised by a different clerk that "juny" had left for the day and knew nothing of my situation. i was advised that the night audit ocurres at approximately six a.m. at which time i would be given another room that would be available at that time. i returned at six a.m. and was told to return in one hour which was convenient to the clerk because his shift ended at that time. i returned to find a third clerk who was finally able to provide me with a different room which was a little better than the first one but was still run down and dirty. i tried to get another hotel but every hotel was booked due to the holiday weekend.if you treasure your trip and would like to spend a nice vaction i would not recommend staying at this hotel. just read some of the reveiews. apparently the management does not care about there hotel. beleive me it shows.

Reviews.Title: “The Highlight of my trip, definitely try to stay here you wont regret it”
Reviews.Author: happy333alaskan
Reviews.Content: Steeped in history, rich in culture, and still filled with artistic icons, the Chelsea Hotel is a "must see" on any trip to NYC. I was fortunate enough to spend my last 3 nights there and it turned out to be without question, the highlight of an already fabulous trip. I had already walked by it and taken pictures a few days before and thought I'd be unable to stay there, but when I saw how astronomically high my room rates at the Hotel Pennsylvania were going to go up over the weekend I got online and started to search desperately for an affordable hotel in the same area, as that's where my friends I was visiting live. When the Hotel Chelsea popped up in my search and was the second lowest in price there was no longer any question. I booked it immediately. As a lover of quantum physics, the fact that Arther C. Clark wrote 2001: A Space Odyssey, there sealed the deal for me. The lobby is in and of itself an experience, with it's famous art and exquisite architecture, and usually filled with both residents and sightseers alike. The staff truly do go "above and beyond" in every way to be helpful and accommodating in every instance. As a first-time visitor from Alaska, who also has Aspergers Syndrome, I felt a little overwhelmed at first by New York, but the kindness of everyone I came into contact there with eased any apprehensions I had. I was also fortunate enough to be there on the day of the once a month tour of the hotel given by Jerry Weinstein, it is not to be missed. I'd schedule my trip around it if I were you. The group is kept below 25 people so book early. It was a fantastic, informative tour where you not only went into Sid and Nancy's room/bathroom (I washed my hands "where Sid did !") your also given the opportunity to meet some of the artists in residence, and talk with them about there work. I was ecstatic when we were taken into Arther C. Clarks old suite on the 10th floor to meet Ms Rita Barros, a charming, beautiful, talented photo journalist who opened her home to us. For me, the highlight of the tour (the whole trip even) turned out to be my few moments with Ms Bettina Grossman, the reclusive artist. Something about her drew us together and I spent the time holding her hand while her assistant read her words to us. When I leaned down and whispered to her about the strength of her grip, she replied with a smile "I'm a sculptor" The few moments I spent with her were like a transcendental experience, and the most cherished memory of the trip. Because I was still on Alaskan time I stayed up late and wandered the halls admiring the artwork and touching EVERYTHING! I'm a very tactile person and made it a point to put my hands on every doorknob on every floor, thinking all the while of all the great cultural icons and not-so-notable people who had touched them before me. The staircase alone is a work of art and the 10th floor had a certain indescribable energy that I won't even attempt to explain or understand. If you ever get the opportunity to stay there DO IT. You'll never regret it! My next trip to NYC will be built around the availability of a room at the Chelsea.

Reviews.Title: “A bohemian pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: vitoaGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Everything I expected the Chelsea to be , I had wanted to stay here since the days of Blondie & Sid Vicious. Full of sun glass wearing freaks like myself living off Daddy's hard earned cash and talking utter nonscense an absolute joy Back next year for my birthday , cant wait .

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably good value, if you can hack a little roughness around the edges.”
Reviews.Author: Mitsi98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in March 2010. Having previously stayed in budget accommodation way uptown, the Hotel Chelsea was a far superior experience. For $105/night inc.tax (I found it cheapest to book via the hotel's own website), I got my own room with a shared bathroom.
