Reviews.Title: “If it hadn't been midnight...”
Reviews.Author: skeenyvr
Reviews.Content: we would have left immediately. Unbelievely, this hotel was recommended by the conference we were attending (what were they thinking??). We paid $269 plus tax for one night. Our experience started when we arrived in the lobby to find what looked like homeless people milling around. Funky it is, with a cool exterior and artwork on every possible interior wall space, but we did not give up immediately. We were booked for 5 nights, and when we checked in, they ran our credit card for the full amount and put the slip in front of us to sign. We asked to see the room first. What kind of hotel bills you the full amount up front? We were given a key and optimistically took our bags to a room on the first floor. It was extremely small, had dirty old carpet on the floor and bare lightbulbs in the entranceway.. There was more but I think you get the idea. We went back down to the reception area and told that the room was unacceptable to us and that we would only be staying one night. They offered to upgrade us to an "apartment" on the 4th floor. It was midnight so we had no choice. The room was bigger with two queen beds, but sill two bare light bulbs in the hallway, cracked paster everywhere and a thousand layers of paint that would not allow the doors to close properly. No tv, not a single glass and no internet access. The smoke detector was beeping because the battery was low and we waited 20 mintues for the staff to come and tell us that they did not have another battery. There were decent towels in the bathroom and lots of hot water. Our room (425) was next door to someone who seemed to be running a psychic reading business--it smelled like dope and when the occupant opened the door to let.someone it, the room was filled with red light and what looked like crushed velet and beads. We asked for a couple of glasses so that I could take an asprin for a growing headache, and were given two wine glasses that the guy at the front desk washed out for us. The "hotel" is also run as apartments (perhaps for unemployed people on income assistance?). We asked someone in the elevator what they were paying a night, and was told $109 but the room had no bathroom and was very small. We left the next morning.The only thing decent about this place was the front desk staff--they were very nice and quite professional, particularly given that we made it clear that the accommodation was unacceptable to us. They refunded the credit card amount for the other nights, but we are expecting to have to pay for the exchange from US to CDN. I would never recommend this "hotel" to anyone, not even my worst enemy. I am not someone who needs to stay in 5 star accommodation (usually choose 3 stars), but this place was barely a one star (is there such a thing as a half star?). They are charging exhorbitant prices based on their status as a heritage site that famous artists onced lived in. I'd recommend you walk in (and then quickly out) of the lobby if you truly want to experience the history of the place. Oddly, there were some tourists in the lobby taking about how "cool" the building was. I guess that accounts for the higher ratings on this place, and everyone is entitled to their opinion. There were several events on in NY so we had a very hard time finding another place to stay. I stumbled across another hotel just down the block, called the Chelsea Savoy Hotel. For $200 per night, we got a nice king bed room with very nice bathroom and coffee and pastries each morning (which we did not sample as we slept in to catch up on missed sleep from our previous night's experience). The hotel staff at the Chelsea Savoy are extremely helpful and very nice, the hotel is very quiet and a much better choice than the Chelsea Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: popcorn63
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel a few months ago and i've read all the reviews and was quite worried about staying there. but what a fab place!! we stayed on the 3rd floor in a lovely room with a private bathroom and small kitchenette. the bed linen was clean and changed every day as were the fluffy bathroom towells. there was a bit of mould around the shower head and the carpet could do with a change but those were the only faults. the staff were lovely and very helpful and we got everything we asked for. the hallways are fantastic with great works of art eveywhere, and sitting in the foyer for a bit is really interesting!! overall i would say that the character of this hotel shines through and is well worth a stay. if you want pristine then don't stay here, but if you want a clean, tidy, groovy hotel then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it”
Reviews.Author: wburhans
Reviews.Content: My wife booked a room at the Chelsea Hotel for a one night visit a few weeks ago. I read the reviews on this website the night before we flew to NYC with our two college-age daughters. I was appalled by some of the comments. We wanted to back out - but of course it was too late. So we decided to tough it out instead. We're happy we did. Our 7th floor room was fantastic - beautiful hardwood floors and tiled fireplace, french doors between our bedroom and an internal foyer and bathroom, and two large windows opening onto a wrought iron balcony, where we spent some time the next morning looking out on the city as it headed to work. Our biggest concern before we arrived - cleanliness - was unwarranted; our room was as clean as any of the four star hotels we've stayed at in NYC and elsewhere. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The Chelsea Hotel is old and it shows. If you're looking for an uber-fashionable but sterile environment designed to make hotel guests feel elite, the Chelsea is not your place. But if you think you might enjoy a stay in a hotel rich in history that attracts a diverse clientele with authentic stories to tell (including those told by some of the outstanding artwork on the walls), I don't think you could make a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: ioweu
Reviews.Content: The bad part is that (aside from feeling as if I could be swept off by hordes of insects in the night), It looks a bit like something out of an old movie; not necessarily in a good way if you catch my drift. While it’s likely that in its heyday many famous folk stayed here (as per the websites historical review), the rooms currently look like… well… like some kind of dive the Motel 6 is infinitely nicer. The room has an overall flavor similar to what one might see in a film whose main character would come to such a place to either plot out his next crime, or to meet with his hooker named Candy. Baseboards that are kind of rotted away in places, leaving gaps through which some kind of vermin or insect may well pay a visit. The carpet is hiding who knows what… the floor feels a bit soft in places beneath it as I walk. Luckily I didn’t pay an unwelcomed visit to some unsuspecting 6th floor guest. On the plus side, it had a kitchenette with glasses and pots and pans and a sink and such. The downside is that none of that looks remotely sanitary enough to actually use. Attempts to dicuss this with the management were futile, connected first to housekeeping and then to a voice mail that was too full to accept another message. Do yourself a favor, avoid the Chelsea as all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Use Caution”
Reviews.Author: CFEF
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, only chose this hotel since every other decent one in the area (location is fantastic!) was at least 400-500 bucks on this particular night. Found online rate for 199.00 for small, double bed room. Upon entering the lobby, I had that terrible sinking feeling in my stomach when I saw the seedy decor and the rough-looking front desk staff (the type normally manning the pay-by-the-hour motels). Luckily I signed on for the upgrade they offered me: for an extra $60, I could get a one-bedroom apartment unit. Here's the review of the room: Positives--Large by NYC standards, 7th floor facing 23rd St., huge balcony, although no doors to get to it, had to climb through the 19th century windows. That's it for the good........ Negatives--Ridiculously flimsy double French doors to get into the room, so don't leave anything valuable when not there. I had crumbs on my bed, a light filmy substance on most furniture, and a bed comforter that I wouldn't dare run a black light over. I only had one thick black hair to take off my bedsheets fortunately, but I did awake in the morning to a strong smell of urine. I only noticed it when the A/C was off. The TV itself and reception were horrible, and the remote was caked in grime/dirt/god-knows-what. Bottom line, for this location you will find bargain prices at this hotel. Do your homework beforehand though, some rooms apparently share bathrooms/showers, and I had no idea of this. However, for anyone that values cleanliness, customer service, or even just walking barefoot in your own hotel room, this place is not for you. As far as the historic, "coolness" factor, you could probably walk through the hotel as a pedestrian and see all that.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had photos..this place it not to be believed...”
Reviews.Author: webdunce
Reviews.Content: Horrible. Filthy room with no a/c. Large window with no shade! The non-functional vent smelled like someone urinated in it which is entirely possible as we had to share a bathroom on the 7th floor. We were in room 720. This room should never be rented out. I was afraid to put my things on the desk which was full of cigarette burns and had a layer of brownish dust that also stank. The bathroom was so disgusting we didn't take showers out of fear! The back wall of the shower was completely popped out exposing the inner guts of the hotel. Looked like where the buses park at Port Authority. Oh, and the tub had a black stain of I can't even begin to imagine what that circled the drain covering about a six inch diameter. Staff very rude except for our bell hop who was very nice. I should have known better when he opened the door to our room and asked us, "Is this okay with you?" I think he was embarrassed. The lobby is very uncomfortable and there isn't anywhere to sit. It was very disappointing as I'd looked forward to staying there for many years. The web site photos are not representative of the hotel in the slightest. Sad, because the building itself just needs some renovation and a little respect.

Reviews.Title: “The Best NY experience EVER!”
Reviews.Author: SmashMan
Reviews.Content: We visit NY City every summer and decided this year to try the Chelsea....after years of ordinary cube size rooms (where you trip on your luggage), window views of brick walls and stale air conditioned air. The Chelsea was like no other..... apartment size, walk in closet, kitchenette and two french doors that open to a balcony....that's right - fresh air! It was clean, comfy and the staff was top notch. The place is virtually an art gallery from top to bottom including the lobby. We never stayed in a friendlier place and it is conveniently located to everything. The Chelsea is what NY is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be scared! Chelsea may be your dream hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CanadianGrrl
Reviews.Content: I almost let the bad reviews here scare me off from staying at the Chelsea Hotel. Am glad I didn't. My girlfriend and I loved staying here this past weekend. But we know what the Chelsea is and is not, and it bears repeating that this hotel is not for everyone. People: this is where Sid killed Nancy. Where Dylan Thomas drunk himself to death. If you think that is romantic, this may be for you. It has not been scrubbed and sanitized into a boutique hotel. If you are just web-searching for the cheapest room in NYC, you may not enjoy its "charms." Ask yourself, would it bother you to find dazed and confused artists-in-residence wandering the halls? Furniture you'd buy at Goodwill? A bathroom doorknob that falls off? Sinks and tubs with the porcelain worn off? If you think the NYC subway is too grimy -- you may not like it here at all. But's it's not dirty! It's just old! Obviously ,the sights and smells will depend on your floor. We booked a double room with shared bath. This is the cheapest -- one double bed, no balcony. We got a clean, comfortable bed, clean, comfortable linens and towels, TV and lights and fan that work, never had to wait for the loo. Staff was friendly and helpful. Elevators are fine (hey, we met some wild folks in there) but the stairs are the way to go. The location is fantastic: steps from two subway lines, a good walk from Times Square and Chelsea art galleries. More importantly, we had an experience staying in a historic building with character (and characters!) we will always remember. Would definitely stay there again -- either budget room or upgrading to the more grand balcony rooms you see on their website. Before this visit I was frustrated that there aren't more budget (under $200 a night) options in Manhattan. Now I know I only need this one.

Reviews.Title: “To Chelsea or not to Chelsea?”
Reviews.Author: Jonifan
Reviews.Content: I booked three nights in the Chelsea Hotel with more than a little trepidation. Having read many reviews about the hotel, with 50% saying "Go anywhere BUT the Chelsea Hotel" and the other 50% saying "Don't stay anywhere EXCEPT the Chelsea Hotel" I wasn't sure how it would turn out. However, I'll paraphrase whoever it was, by saying that all other hotels are nouns but the Chelsea is without doubt a verb. First of all, despite the dates I wanted being apparently full, a quick e-mail sorted that one out and the dates were quickly deemed fine. I also read that the Chelsea was like a beautiful woman just past her prime. Well, she's had a bus pass for several years now and is also waiting for a hip replacement on the NHS but wow! - she can still get around! The room was clean, huge and overlooked W. 23rd Street with a marvellous balcony. Much has been said about the decor and I won't repeat all that here. Suffice to say that you just HAVE to do the walk from the top floor down to the lobby - and expect the unexpected! Staff were courteous (saving us money by advising on the best cab to take back to the airport) and the place has a presence that just can't be described on here. I'm with the 50% that'll be staying there again. Thanks to everyone there for their kindness.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Nick_and_Michael
Reviews.Content: Large rooms, clean, a kitchenette, hardwood floors, oozing with character, great location. Those are the good points. On the bad side, it lacked modern conveniences (like internet in your room) and the bathroom was on the edge of what I find acceptable (the door didn't latch right and the shower curtain was of the plastic walmart variety). Overall, we had a great stay, but I wouldn't recommend the place to just any of my friends. A sense of adventure is required.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: newpalawan
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. So much history. Bob Dylan, Jimi Hendrix, Janis Joplin, Patti Smith, Leonard Cohen Stayed here. We had a very nice, clean renovated room. Nice bathroom and kitchenette. The staff were very friendly. Maybe we were lucky but we will go back. Wonderfull hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant Hotel Staff and very very over priced!!!”
Reviews.Author: Piggy&Bubu
Reviews.Content: Knowing all the history of The Chelsea Hotel I Always wanted to stay at this hotel and breath in the history. Considering the awful reviews on Tripadvisor I had to beg my wife to stay here. ITS REALLY OVER PRICED. I knew what the expect from the rooms, there "Old " drab and the hotel is a wreck BUT i already knew that its not what dissapointed me,I can see why some people revel in this quirky old dog. What really got on my nerves was how rude and generally arrogant the staff were there, the hotel is living off its reputation and will always be busy but It wont get any awards for the hotel staff. There was one younger guy on reception who seemed to have total contempt for the guests. The rooms themselves are what you'd expect in a B&B or lodging house in Blackpool but were very clean.Dont be fooled by the hotel web site. If it was not for the history of this old hotel the place would have been ripped down a long time ago. I'd stay here again (IF THE PRICE WAS NOT SO DAFT) but not sure If I could deal with the delusions of grande from some of the hotel staff but my wife would not stay in this hotel if it was the last place in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Missa2002
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We booked there because it was historic and we thought it had a nice charm to it based on the pictures on the site. With the Chelsea, historic means OLD! The room they gave us looked nothing like the pictures online. It was old and dingy. The tub was completly scrapped up, the kitchenette was old. Nothing more then a beat up fridge, used looking, plates stuffed in a closet. Room in need of a SERIOUS paint job and new comforter. Oh but the view from the balcoy was lovely...until I turned to the right and saw an old shopping cart next to me! Even after all this we decided it was just one night. Later on we meet a couple who was staying down the hall from us. There first room they said, looked like a room fit for a crack house. They complained so much they got an upgrade to a better room, that they probably save for people who complain. When we got in later that night to go to bed, my friend woke up to a bug on her face that bit her, pulled back the sheets and found more bugs just like it. Heres where the story turned bad. One person working at the front desk who was a liar, rude, and overall jerk. Was not trying to help us whatsoever. We went back and forth for a long time, didnt want to help us find another hotel, lied about numerous things, manager wasnt there and would not return calls. Finally at 4 in the morning, the Chelsea Savoy next door took pity on us and let us stay there for 100 bucks less then what they would normanlly charge. We are now in the process of getting the Chelsea to pay for our hotel stay at the second hotel. Will NEVER stay here again. Side note, dont be disturbed by all the weed you will smell on your floor, as the man at the front desk said "I mean...people live here thats to be expected!"

Reviews.Title: “never again!!”
Reviews.Author: lluvnycndc
Reviews.Content: We walked into the hotel to find a very dirty, dugusting lobby the seats in the lobby were very dirty (a couch that should have been beige was almost black in color) . There were some very strange people lurking in the lobby. We stayed in room #425 which was not too bad of a room considering the fact it was only for a night. I woke up however around 2am and started itching on my face, I looked on the pillow and saw BED BUGS!!! I looked in the mirror and noticed my face had been bitten. I then pulled back the covers to find LITTLE WHITE BUGS crawling!!! When we told the guy at the front desk her ignored us and said the hotel was full so we couldn't change our room. We ended up looking for another hotel at 4AM!!! Not to mention the whole hallway smelled like Marijuana. The empolyees said "what do you expect people live here". I think they all smoke weed together the employees and the residents... PLEASE NO ONE STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chelsea Hotel - just dont go!”
Reviews.Author: sid33
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a short break and after staying at the hotel for approx 7 hours we moved out! - it was dreadful - yes people were very friendly as were their pets! - but this Hotel cannot and should not just hang off the back of its rock history - we were only looking for a base, and we would have preferred not to have had to leave at all, as it turned out a very expensive move due to the fact that the Pope was in town and the only place available was the Milennium Hilton! - but there was no way at all we were sleeping in that place! Barbara April 2008

Reviews.Title: “You'll Love it or Hate it!”
Reviews.Author: tim_m
Reviews.Content: Interesting to read the earlier reviews: my wife hated the place because it was ... dirty, lacking in facilities, ill-equipped, smelly in public areas, full of 'odd fellow-guests', expensive, unhelpful at counter etc. I loved it because it was ... full of history and atmosphere, rough round the edges but essentially friendly, spacious, a nice contrast to the over-manicured New York norm. I have to admit though, all her criticisms were well-founded! Give it a try, but be warned ...!

Reviews.Title: “even artsy people might not like it”
Reviews.Author: iriswashere
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay here because I dug the history of the place -- the artists and musicians who had stayed and lived here. But many things went wrong: the lobby was dusty and needed cleaning, and they allowed a homeless person to hang out there all day. From the service you can tell that no one here graduated from hotel school. The final straw was when they charged my ATM/Debit card TWICE, leaving me with NO money in my bank account. They said that they couldn't reverse it until Monday (it was a Saturday)!! Needless to say tears were shed (on my part) since I was then stuck in NYC with no money. I'm very into artsy rock n'roll scene, but stay far, far away from this place.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Orla_98
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and sometime during the next day when we were out a laptop was stolen from our room. We think it was an inside job as the room was turned down. The police came and said that the same sort of job had happened the week before involving, books and alcohol from another room that in turn had been turned down. We left and when I called the next day, I was told the housekeeping manager would give me a call after she asked her staff about the stolen laptop. Of course, I have not heard a word since. We think that hardly anyone that works there, delivers there, or lives there is to be trusted. If you stay there, bring nothing and nothing will be yours to keep.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Keithtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump. The remote control for the TV in 3 rooms did not work, no blow dryer no iron, the heater is old and works poorly. The locks on the doors are broken. The staff is rude and apathetic. The contents of my room was removed by the I assume the hotel staff but they would not help find it. I called the police and they advised me that they had to visit the hotel frequently due to problems. The area is not great do not stay here if you are a business traveler looking for a nice affordable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Experience it yourself!”
Reviews.Author: alandy69
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at the hotel at 5pm on a Sunday night. We were then promptly shown to our room, which was #324. They were friendly, helpful, and gave us directions to the restraunt we were going to. After reading some reviews on here I wasn't quite sure what to expect. But my god, was our room amazing! At a rate of $130 a night, we had splatter painted walls (in a sort of less overwhelming jackson pollock style), twelve foot ceilings, stylish furniture, and to top it off a 32" flat screen LG tv! Did i mention that our room was three times the size of my own living room? (which is not small to begin with). I would definitely come back here, and probably will soon. Maybe we just got lucky with our room, but some of the reviews on here sounded horrible. But i guess it just goes to show you, experience it for yourself, and form your own opinion before deciding from someone else's opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Very run down, not 3.5 stars as advertised”
Reviews.Author: jfin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was run down with paint peeling off of the bathroom ceiling. The interior smelled of smoke. The overall condition was not worthy of the 3.5 star rating on hotels.com. I was very disappointed because I chose to pay more and walk further to my destination because this hotel had a higher star rating that others. My colleagues at another hotel had much better accommodations. I would have not been so disappointed if the hotel had a star rating of 1 or 2 stars instead of 3.5. I was there with a colleague for a convention. The bathroom door wouldn't shut and lock because there were so many layers of pealing paint on the woodwork. I hope to have better luck next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Reasons for staying at the Chelsea”
Reviews.Author: TwoMusicians
Reviews.Content: Listen - just think carefully about your reasons for staying at the Chelsea. If you travel a lot and like your hotels homogonised like Hampton Inns, Howard Johnson, Holiday Inn etc then DON'T book at the Chelsea. If you expect your rooms to be sanitised with everything working perfectly then DON'T book at the Chelsea. However, if you are interested in art, culture, decaying architecture and staying in a piece of history and can tolerate a bit of shabbiness then you won't be disappointed by what the Chelsea has to offer. We are two musicians from the UK who stayed at the Chelsea for a week in August 2007. We had a Junior Suite for $200 a night which seemed good value for NYC. Even better given that we had an art gallery to enjoy every time we walked down the stairway. There are many scare stories on this site about the folks who inhabit the Chelsea (75% is tenanted to long term residents many of whom are eccentric) but we returned to our rooms in the early hours most nights after returning from jazz clubs and met no trouble. We had to leave two expensive guitars in the room (as we couldn't walk round the city with them during the day) and they were still there when we left. Our room was clean, nicely furnished with antique pieces and the staff were firendly and helpful. Do your homework, read the reviews and read books such as Legends of the Chelsea Hotel by Ed Hamilton or Chelsea Horror Hotel by Dee Dee Ramone for a flavour of what the Chelsea is all about. At the time we stayed the Chelsea had just been sold to new corporate investors. Time will tell what effect this will have on the place. The tenants were nervous about their future and the liklihood is that the rooms will be refurbished and room rates will rise. Whether the character of the place will be preserved is difficult to say but I am pessimistic. If you have an interest in the Chelsea's history then you will love staying here. If you know nothing of its background DON'T book here - you will be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I have been itching ever since”
Reviews.Author: MelinDC
Reviews.Content: I started itching on my first night there and 2 weeks later have not stopped. My dermatologist can't even figure it out. Could be mites, lice, God only knows. Never going back!! Having enjoyed my last stay there in 2003, I can't tell you what a disappointment the abominable service and deteriorated rooms were. Even though we arrived late, it took two hours and several phone calls to get a room ready that we had paid over $300 for. Save your money and your health... go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “A lifetime's ambition fulfilled !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traethmelyn
Reviews.Content: It has long been my ambition to stay at this famous hotel and I've finally achieved it. It lived up to all my expectations. It is full of character, atmosphere, ambience and you can almost feel the spirits of all those guests and residents who have stayed here in days gone by !! I will definitely be coming back one day. For those of you looking for a modern, light, bustling hotel, this is not the place for you. Rather for those of us who like to stay amongst the quiet, eccentric individuals who find the atmosphere of the Chelsea inspiring and thought provoking, this is the hotel for you. I only hope the management never decide to reburbish or modernise this landmark hotel. I love the dimly lit corridors, the beautiful wrought ironwork and the dated furniture. Every picture tells a story .......

Reviews.Title: “Character Central”
Reviews.Author: Ann R
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for 5 stars and lots of amenities, look somewhere else. This is more like a visit to an independent film than a luxurious vacation spot, which is exactly what I was looking for when I met up here with my best girlfriend to revisit my 20-something starving artist fantasy. The location is great - close to subways, shops, restaurants. The building is great - an old institution loaded with character and great artwork in the stairwell (you must climb or descend it at least once). It's definitely not a "posh" place, but so richly haunted with all the legends that have stayed there. And the hotel continues to house a colorful cast of characters, which adds to the fun. No doubt, there are more legends in the making.. and their loitering in the stairwell this very minute! The rooms are ok... beds were surprisingly comfortable. Seemed clean enough. The staff is mostly very friendly and helpful (but bring a printout if you reserve anything online to avoid any confusion). It's not for everybody, and maybe not for every day, but you just can't get this anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful”
Reviews.Author: WBY
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 821 for two nights. It hasn't been painted since Mark Twain stayed in the hotel. Even in college in the 1980s I didn't stay in such a dive. It's a disgrace. I wouldn't be a bit surprised if it's haunted as the whole place is seriously spooky. Don't stay here!!! Just have a look in the lobby and then pass on by. Yes, I am a big fan of music and the arts. And I still think it's to be avoided. The only good thing is the location. Also, you will think your own home palatial upon return. Also, you will stay out late in the Village getting the best out of the music there as you won't want to go back to the room. I travelled all around Vietnam on a low budget and I never stayed anywhere this horrible. The staff are nice though. My poor boyfriend is still there, he turned ballistic yesterday morning. I had to clear out. I wouldn't come here for a romantic holiday. But it must be unbearably spooky on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant rooms, central to everything”
Reviews.Author: 17travelbud
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is amazing.From the size of the rooms to the decor throughout the lobbies its brilliant. Everyone knows about the famous people who have stayed here, that just adds a little extra to an already cool hotel. Really close to everything . Some great food and bars around. Doormen very friendly, I loved it and will be staying there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “this place is an overpriced dump”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler75
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an absolute nightmare, the rooms are awful (dirty and worn). There is not even a hairdryer in the room (but available on request). A bit creepy, too (would not go there as a woman traveling alone). It smells and it is noisy. A friend had cockroaches. And all that for $329 plus tax.

Reviews.Title: “the bad outweighs the good”
Reviews.Author: MaryDunne
Reviews.Content: Good things: very central location, lots of cultural cachet, not a homogenized pasteurized processed hotel product. Bad things: overall room shabbiness (room 231), view of airshaft, creaky mattress, pipes knocking in the walls all night, bare lightbulbs, dirty carpet, creaky doors and floors that echo loudly in the marble hallways, groaning refrigerator motor, clueless staff. Two unforgiveable things: I did not get a wake-up call on the one day I requested it, and I FOUND A TOENAIL CLIPPING IN THE BED!!!!!!!! (I never once clipped my nails in that room, so it definitely wasn't mine.) I can only assume that they did not change the sheets after the last guest before me. I can put up with a lot to stay in a hotel with lots of history in a great location, but I cannot deal with sleeping in a stranger's dirty sheets. Highly UNrecommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there! It's a dump!!”
Reviews.Author: SeriousTraveler001
Reviews.Content: This hotel was sold to me online as a 3.5 star property. I feel like a victim of fraud. I travel frequently for business and figured that I'd try someplace different. The Chelsea hardly deserves 1 star. The thought that it could even be put in the same category as the Grand Hyatt or other fine properties is a joke. My room was filthy and not even remotely charming. The pictures online are nothing like the real thing and I question if the pictures that are posted online are truly taken at the Chelsea or if they were taken elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: nyjane
Reviews.Content: This was the most discusting hotel ever. Besides being completely unaccomodating, ther were huge roaches running accross the hallway every time I walked to the elevator (which barely ran). The housekeeping only folded dirty towels and made the bed. Did not vacuum up dead roaches. The staff was rude and unprofessional. There was usually not a bellman and the heaters were broken... I would not recomend this hotel to anyone. It was unsanitary and in need of serious renovations.

Reviews.Title: “maybe they are coasting a little but I loved it anyway”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieBrown
Reviews.Content: I thought it was very expensive, the room was kind of dusty, there was no iron and no iron forthcoming over a couple of days, no one had too much idea and I am sure that the hotel is coasting on its reputation. maybe this won't last mnuch longer before they need to e.g. clean a little better, BUT there is a lovely vibe there and it is quiet and I slept really well in my odd kind of room. It gets by on atmosphere. Lifts incredibly slow but it was a journey in iteself.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: unknownparts
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at this historic building! Our room was very clean, and suprisingly large for the price we paid. We stayed in room 407, purple walls and two large windows that opened up to the crazy cool balcony outside... I spent more time enjoying that balcony than I did roaming the city... It should be noted this is a bohemian, stylish, and artsy farsty community living in and staying in this hotel... young and old can enjoy this place, if you let yourself go... and you don't expect too much ( or expect a luxury hotel ) It can be a little noisy, 2 parties fired up on balconies next to ours, but instead of complaining... we just joined the party! can't wait to go back next year, I hated to leave this place!

Reviews.Title: “dont ask about sid vicious”
Reviews.Author: sidney78
Reviews.Content: awesome hotel if you are not too high end.great piece of history.parties in the rooms,and interesting people to talk to.desk clerks cool once you get to know them just please dont ask about sid or nancy,i feel that hotel is famous for sid vicious and other musicians as well but when asked to stay in sids old room from say about 29 years ago staff acted like i killed someone.they say they demolished the room they just chang ed the room numbers.overall review super cool place.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Poolie18
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved my stay at the Chelsea. Yes, the building is old and maybe a little creepy. But my room was clean and extremely spacious, especially for Manhattan standards. The price I got couldn't be beat and the neighborhood is the perfect location for great dinner and drinks. Of course, the history helps. It was definitely a thrill to wonder who had been in the room before me.

Reviews.Title: “Special and unique”
Reviews.Author: bln_travel
Reviews.Content: First of all: Staff was very friendly and accommodating. always in the mood to have a little chat with you. Nice bars and restaurants spread all over the next two blocks so no problem to grab a drink or something to eat (no restaurant/bar available in the hotel). And if you don´t mind a walk you can easily walk to the Times Square and all the downton tourist attractions (30-40 minutes). Easy to reach by subway from JFK airport. The hotel itself, hmmm. I´m still not really sure whether I liked it or not ;-) The atmosphere is kind of cool, at least not the stereotype of an ordinary hotel. The permanant residents seem to be a bunch of "oddballs", had a couple of funny chats. I defnitely liked the lobby and stairway, packed with pictures. You can feel the hotel´s famous history here. For NY our room was really big. Unexpectedly we had a kitchenette, which we didn´t use because it was far away from what I call clean.. At first glance, the rest of the room (including the bathroom) was relatively clean. But you better don´t doublecheck this ;-). Don´t look to much at the carpet, especially in the corners or into he drawers. But our bed and the bathroom were ok, and after all the horror-stories I´ve heard about "cheap" hotels in NYC I was satisfied with the room. Of course it´s far away from the standard I know from German hotels, but I think for a NY hotel we found a nice place for a reasonable price with a unique atmosphere in a relaxed neiborhood and close to Manhattan´s tourist center.

Reviews.Title: “What a pigsty!”
Reviews.Author: windsurfmd
Reviews.Content: Actually I did NOT stay there, thank goodness, altho I had made reservations for three nights for myself, daughter, granddaughter and daughter-in-law.. I booked a suite with 2 bedrooms and private bath on their website. Fortunately I double-checked a couple of days prior to our trip. I was informed that they did not have a suite available for me as both were booked thru the weekend. After much discussion and anger on my part I accepted 2 separate rooms. When we arrived at the hotel we were shown rooms with only a double bed in each. When I said that would not do we were shown 2 other rooms with 2 beds in each. However, after this grand tour I knew there was no way I could stay in that hotel - musty, smoky hallways, dirty carpeting, very old, dirty bathrooms (peeling paint, exposed pipes, moldy tile). It may have a history, but that does not make it a desirable place to stay. I will say that the staff was polite and let me cancel my reservations with no charge.

Reviews.Title: “Coasting on a long lost rep...”
Reviews.Author: Yermaanmadug
Reviews.Content: The Chelsea seems to have been coasting on its reputation for a long, long time. It seems to attract the kind of people the people who made it famous were trying to avoid. That is, twee folk - students, middle-aged 'arty' couples, wealthy young guys who like to think they're wild and dangerous but can afford to stand in the lobby exaggeratedly speeding out of their [--] while handing over their stack of hundred dollar bills for their weekly rent. There's even a vogue editor and her lawyer husband and their children living in a double suite on the eighth floor. 'We just looove the atmosphere!' They pay Manhatten prices to stay at the run-down Chelsea for its Boho-chic when they would complain about staying at a similar priced establishement with the same shoddy rooms elsewhere. The people who made the Chelsea famous would never dream of staying there these days. Do yourself a favour, take an adventure elsewhere and find the modern equivalent of what the Chelsea used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: EalingDwellers
Reviews.Content: We were drawn to this hotel due to its reputation and history. We were not disappointed at all. It has 10 times more character than most hotels in Manhattan and if you're expecting plush furnishings and matching decor in spotless rooms then WHY BOOK THE CHELSEA HOTEL???? Staff were really helpful and the art throughout the hotel, especially in the stairwells was really interesting. Chelsea is a great neighbourhood, full of interesting people and places, and just round the corner from the fantastic Empire diner. As hotel residents we were also able to jump the queue to enter the nightclub attached to the hotel. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Chelsea hotel and will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Lattetime
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not live up to it's billing. A Cool and hip reputation is great but It was not clean or well cared for. Would never stay there again. Overpriced for a dirty, shabby room.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Yes, this place has the history and stayed in the room next to the now closed location of Sid Vicious's room 100. I did not know of the history of the facility, nor really cared before arrival, as it was as always in NYC, location, location, location. My biggest gripe was $300/night for a kitchenette that had the same countertop as my parent's original kitchen of their 1949 house. Or the bathroom with the shiny tile panels dating from the early 1970's. Then there was the toilet that had a leaky wax drain seal ['donut']. Groovy is fine, and I like the hip clientelle (also happy to not ever see any suits walking sround with ever-present cellphone/Blackberries/Palm Pilots) but the price is too much for a room with twenty layers of paint and an overwhelming steam radiator that one had to keep both windows open to keep comfortable. Being hip means not forgetting value as well. And this is the place to stay if you want to fawn in the memories of Thomas Dylan, Jimmie Hendrix, et. al. Just be prepared to pay for it. And yes, the Spanish Restaurant El Quihote is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “most pleasent and interesting stay.”
Reviews.Author: brianbji
Reviews.Content: I had a good large room at the front...feb 7 05.... great writing desk but I didnt get to write my novel! I paid c$200 per night for 9th floor; a little overpriced for NYC at that time of year but what a wonderful atmosphere. Hotel and Room clean and comfortable. Most interesting unique reception staff (and guests) and its great fun just to sit in the lobby for an hour or too and pick up on the buzz. I felt completely at home and didnt see anyone with a raincoat, briefcase or suit.. thank god.. Wide age group generally with a young 20-30 crowd, artists students etc I guess, in the long term accomodations. Certainly not the average boring NYC hotel experience. But at the same time not the same standard as the Algonquin for example. Good restaurants nearby (including the spanish one next door) and great bar downstairs (not mondays)

Reviews.Title: “Creepy bohemian chic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nobody stays at the Chelsea for the rooms or the dreary midtown location - it's the history that attracts. Dylan Thomas went out from here to drink himself to death, Andy Warhol filmed The Chelsea Girls and Sid Vicious murdered his girlfriend Nancy Spungen in room 100. Our room at the rear was plain, small and shabby. By all accounts the rooms at the front are the most desirable and difficult to get. There are many long term residents and there appeared to be a small religious cult in residence on our floor. The corridors are wide, gloomy and mysterious and reception is full of "art" contributed by residents. Staff were friendly and helpful. The building itself is a beautiful piece of architecture and there was an excellent spanish seafood restaurant next door.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few months when working. If you are someone who doesn't want five star but more shabby chic then this is the place. It is completely different to any place I have stayed in before. It is a mish mash of creative thinking. It feels old and homely - the people next door to me were there for a year. It's not spotless and stark but feels like you are staying in apartments. They even have rooms with kitchens if you need it Staff are fab - the best experiences I have ever had.
